metadata.title: CVE-2019-11191 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible
metadata.description:
** DISPUTED ** The Linux kernel through 5.0.7, when CONFIG_IA32_AOUT isenabled and ia32_aout is loaded, allows local users to bypass ASLR onsetuid a.out programs (if any exist) because install_exec_creds() is calledtoo late in load_aout_binary() in fs/binfmt_aout.c, and thus theptrace_may_access() check has a race condition when reading /proc/pid/stat.NOTE: the software maintainer disputes that this is a vulnerability becauseASLR for a.out format executables has never been supported.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11191` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-51-generic - 4.15.0-51.55
linux-image-4.15.0-51-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-51.55
linux-image-4.15.0-51-lowlatency - 4.15.0-51.55
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-51-generic - 4.15.0-51.55
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-51-lowlatency - 4.15.0-51.55
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1037-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1037.39
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1054-snapdragon - 4.15.0-1054.58
No subscription required
